Nursing: Mental Health Nursing                                                                                     < Back Advanced Certificate Program in Advanced Practice Nursing: Mental Health Nursing Program Highlights     Innovative academic and clinical preparation in advanced practice adult psychiatric-mental health nursing across the lifespan   Opportunity to develop subspecialty expertise in substance related disorders   Direct collaboration with nationally and internationally renowned faculty in the field of psychiatric-mental health nursing and substance related disorders   Participate in spearheading innovative social change   Graduates of this program are eligible for the ANCC Family and Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certification Examination       Program Requirements: 12-36 credits, 750 clinical hours   Courses                Advanced Practice Core (15 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2020               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan I              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2022               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan II              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2012               Advanced Physical Assessment Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2021               Clinical Pharmacotherapeutics Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2013               Contemporary Clinical Practice: Advanced Practice Roles              (3)             Spring, Summer                  Population Component - Psychiatric-Mental Health (21 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2136               Mental Health I: Individual Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2137               Mental Health II: Foundation of Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2138               Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Summer                      NURSE-GN 2139               Mental Health IV: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Theory              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2140               Mental Health V: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Pracitum and Supervision              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2141               Mental Health VI: Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Theory              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2142               Mental Health VII: Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Practicum and Supervision              (3)             Spring                              Program Coordinator Faculty                             Mary T. Rosedale ,                  PhD, PMHNP-BC ,       Assistant Professor,               mtr3@nyu.edu                               Practicum Opportunities                   Pioneering clinical placements in diverse urban settings   Premier teaching hospital centers (e.g., Mt. Sinai Medical Center, NYU Langone Medical Center, Bellevue, Bronx Lebanon, Gouverneur Hospital)   Select private practice offices or community-based practice sites supportive of Psychiatric Nursing Practitioner role development   All placements are arranged by faculty   Placement possibilities are available throughout the tri-state area       Gainful Employment Disclosure               Attachment Size     Advanced Certificate Mental Health Curriculum Sheet 36.67 KB                          Graduate            MS MS Program Policies     Advanced Certificate Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics Focus on Interprofessional Primary Care for Older Adults with Multiple Chronic Conditions   Advanced Practice Nursing: Palliative Care     Dual Degree BS/MS   Dual Degree MS/MPH   DNP   PhD PhD Admissions Policies   PhD Program Policies     Compare DNP and PhD   Non-Degree                            Back to top                                                    Contact   Academic Bulletin   Open Positions   Site Map   NYU College of Dentistry   Legal   Site Credits

Program Highlights     Innovative academic and clinical preparation in advanced practice adult psychiatric-mental health nursing across the lifespan   Opportunity to develop subspecialty expertise in substance related disorders   Direct collaboration with nationally and internationally renowned faculty in the field of psychiatric-mental health nursing and substance related disorders   Participate in spearheading innovative social change   Graduates of this program are eligible for the ANCC Family and Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certification Examination       Program Requirements: 12-36 credits, 750 clinical hours   Courses                Advanced Practice Core (15 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2020               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan I              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2022               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan II              (3) Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan                      NURSE-GN 2138, 3 Credits, (Summer)  This advanced practice course is designed to systematically explore the theory and apply the practice of group, couple, and family psychotherapy across the lifespan. The major theories of group, couple, and family therapy (e.g., group dynamics, systems therapy, structural therapy, emotion-focused therapy, cognitive-behavioral) and various contemporary approaches are analyzed with a focus on understanding their underlying theoretical assumptions and relevant concepts of health, psychopathology and change. Students will examine and critique the evidence-base of various approaches appropriate for different age groups as well as for various clinical issues, paying specific attention to diversity in culture, lifestyle and values. The group, couple, and family therapy role of the psychiatric mental health advanced practice nurse relative to intra and interprofessional practice, ethical, legal and policy considerations are examined. The clinical simulation component focuses on the application and demonstration of group, couple and family psychotherapy skills. Mental Health Curriculum Sheet                                              Academics                   Home > Academics > Graduate > Advanced Certificate > Overview > Advanced Practice Nursing: Mental Health Nursing                                                                                     < Back Advanced Certificate Program in Advanced Practice Nursing: Mental Health Nursing Program Highlights     Innovative academic and clinical preparation in advanced practice adult psychiatric-mental health nursing across the lifespan   Opportunity to develop subspecialty expertise in substance related disorders   Direct collaboration with nationally and internationally renowned faculty in the field of psychiatric-mental health nursing and substance related disorders   Participate in spearheading innovative social change   Graduates of this program are eligible for the ANCC Family and Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certification Examination       Program Requirements: 12-36 credits, 750 clinical hours   Courses                Advanced Practice Core (15 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2020               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan I              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2022               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan II              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2012               Advanced Physical Assessment Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2021               Clinical Pharmacotherapeutics Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2013               Contemporary Clinical Practice: Advanced Practice Roles              (3)             Spring, Summer                  Population Component - Psychiatric-Mental Health (21 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2136               Mental Health I: Individual Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2137               Mental Health II: Foundation of Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2138               Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Summer                      NURSE-GN 2139               Mental Health IV: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Theory              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2140               Mental Health V: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Pracitum and Supervision              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2141               Mental Health VI: Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Theory              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2142               Mental Health VII: Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Practicum and Supervision              (3)             Spring                              Program Coordinator Faculty                             Mary T. Rosedale ,                  PhD, PMHNP-BC ,       Assistant Professor,               mtr3@nyu.edu                               Practicum Opportunities                   Pioneering clinical placements in diverse urban settings   Premier teaching hospital centers (e.g., Mt. Sinai Medical Center, NYU Langone Medical Center, Bellevue, Bronx Lebanon, Gouverneur Hospital)   Select private practice offices or community-based practice sites supportive of Psychiatric Nursing Practitioner role development   All placements are arranged by faculty   Placement possibilities are available throughout the tri-state area       Gainful Employment Disclosure               Attachment Size     Advanced Certificate Mental Health Curriculum Sheet 36.67 KB                          Graduate            MS MS Program Policies     Advanced Certificate Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics Focus on Interprofessional Primary Care for Older Adults with Multiple Chronic Conditions   Advanced Practice Nursing: Palliative Care     Dual Degree BS/MS   Dual Degree MS/MPH   DNP   PhD PhD Admissions Policies   PhD Program Policies     Compare DNP and PhD   Non-Degree                            Back to top                                                    Contact   Academic Bulletin   Open Positions   Site Map   NYU College of Dentistry   Legal   Site Credits

Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan                      NURSE-GN 2138, 3 Credits, (Summer)  This advanced practice course is designed to systematically explore the theory and apply the practice of group, couple, and family psychotherapy across the lifespan. The major theories of group, couple, and family therapy (e.g., group dynamics, systems therapy, structural therapy, emotion-focused therapy, cognitive-behavioral) and various contemporary approaches are analyzed with a focus on understanding their underlying theoretical assumptions and relevant concepts of health, psychopathology and change. Students will examine and critique the evidence-base of various approaches appropriate for different age groups as well as for various clinical issues, paying specific attention to diversity in culture, lifestyle and values. The group, couple, and family therapy role of the psychiatric mental health advanced practice nurse relative to intra and interprofessional practice, ethical, legal and policy considerations are examined. The clinical simulation component focuses on the application and demonstration of group, couple and family psychotherapy skills.
